source.title: Lateral habenula as a source of negative reward signals in dopamine neurons

confidence_rationale: Direct primate physiology evidence for signed negative-value signaling through lateral habenula influence on dopamine pathways, aligned with REE signed harm/benefit precision separation.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Lateral habenula neurons encode negative reward-related signals and can drive inhibitory effects on dopamine neurons.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports MECH-054 requirement for signed harm/benefit-sensitive precision routing rather than unsigned scalar error handling.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Source is primate task neurophysiology and does not by itself specify full REE control-plane implementation details.
mapping.source_context: Rhesus monkey reward-biased saccade task with concurrent habenula and dopamine recordings.

confidence_components.notes: Strong causal/temporal signal relation evidence; moderate transfer risk from biological circuit to abstract REE control-plane parameterization.
